metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16883 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
sssd versions from 1.13.0 to before 2.0.0 did not properly restrict accessto the infopipe according to the "allowed_uids" configuration parameter. Ifsensitive information were stored in the user directory, this could beinadvertently disclosed to local attackers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16883` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libipa-hbac0 - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
libnss-sss - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
libpam-sss - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
libsss-certmap0 - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
libsss-idmap0 - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
libsss-nss-idmap0 - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
libsss-simpleifp0 - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
libsss-sudo - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
libwbclient-sssd - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
python3-libipa-hbac - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
python3-libsss-nss-idmap - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
python3-sss - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
sssd - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
sssd-ad - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
sssd-ad-common - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
sssd-common - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
sssd-dbus - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
sssd-ipa - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
sssd-kcm - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
sssd-krb5 - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
sssd-krb5-common - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
sssd-ldap - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
sssd-proxy - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
sssd-tools - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sssd package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.3-3ubuntu0.9').
